Grozone is a flourishing community garden, horticulture and wildlife project in the middle of Northwich, Cheshire. 

Opening times: Mon-Sat 10am - 3pm

users.name: Eco Communities UK
users.description: New organisation supporting Cheshire West & Chester Council to mitigate climate change and helping to make the area greener and more sustainable.

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text: Am getting reports that Kyle & Upper Ouse IDB are dredging Bur Dike and flailed hedge alongside at Bootham Stray area in #York. Hope an ecologist checked for nests of birds and water voles? @IDBYorkshire @CityofYork @CliftonBackies @Clifton_Ward @NEYorksNLincs @EnvAgencyYNE

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @StaffsPolice Hang on I rang over a week ago to report being gased by toxic landfill H2S in my home & was told that officers would be round to check. Are you now saying your officers don't go out and I was the one being lied to? We never hear from you on here unless it's to defend yourselves.
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids So a spot check finds 6 loads when they make the effort that 42 a week. So 2184 a year and you wonder why we suffer.
6 loads! what was happening before the @EnvAgencyMids made you check every load! https://t.co/08NjiPSfYN

HISTORIC MOMENT - shad are through the Diglis fish pass👏

Water companies announced over £2.7 billion of investment in the #GreenRecovery today. This includes £157 million to help eliminate harm caused by storm overflows + trial the creation of two new bathing rivers. [1/3] https://t.co/LblVXj5L0b

#OxfordFloodScheme will be formed of a new stream surrounded by gently sloping wetland – here’s an artist's impression from the Devil’s Backbone. #partnerships with @OxfordCity @OxfordshireCC @whitehorseDC @southoxon @UniofOxford @earth_trust – more at https://t.co/ReD08hDmu2 https://t.co/uCOKWp4yTx

We need your👀on the #SevernShadRun!
Watch 1-minute film clips and help us count shad passing the weir notch at Tewkesbury. 
#CitizenScience data on run size will provide an important baseline for tracking shad's resurgence in years to come! #FollowTheShad
https://t.co/WtQo7BBRLl https://t.co/FsR9g2eVnB

@EnvAgency @GlobalUnion3 Remember: 24 - 48 hours after a significant precipitation event, outflow pipes from sewage treatment plants pour thousands of gallons of untreated sewage into the water... Many times no warnings are posted until the level is so unsafe it causes severe sickness. Check first always

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @EmmaHowardBoyd @Ofwat @OfwatChair @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA Your Agency required the industry to classify and rectify its many failing overflows within 3 years in 2018 but you let them off the hook for some reason. Care to explain why?

They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG
